DOC.brief_summary: Patients with mild to moderate hypertension, dyslipidemia (imbalanced blood lipids) and decreased vascular dilatation, receiving a cholesterol lowering diet were given either valsartan or fluvastatin for 8 weeks. At week 8 all patients were administered a combination treatment with valsartan 160 mg and fluvastatin 80 mg.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Fluvastatin or Valsartan and Their Combination in Dyslipidemic Patients With Hypertension and Endothelial Dysfunction
DOC.criteria: Arterial hypertension Dyslipidemia Cholesterol lowering diet Constant antihypertensive treatment Diabetes mellitus Myocardial infarction or stroke in the previous 3 months Other inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply
